intro: Oldenlandia obtusiloba, commonly known as the blunt-leaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a waxy texture. Oldenlandia obtusiloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
